div1.head: Letter from W.S. Leathers to Henry Rose Carter, September 17, 1923
div1.opener:
W.W. HALL, M.D., PRES., SHELBY, MISS.
J.H. McNEILL, M.D., OLIVE BRANCH, MISS.
B. LAMPTON CRAWFORD, M.D., JUVENILETOWNS, MISS.
T.F. ELKIN, M.D., TUPELO, MISS.
H.F. GARRISON, M.D., CAMPTON, MISS.
L.L. McDOUGAL, M.D., BOOMVILLE, MISS.
MISSISSIPPI STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
T.W. REAGAN, M.D., UNION, MISS.
C.D. MITCHELL, M.D., JACKSON, MISS.
I.L. PARSONS, M.D., MISS.
E.M. GAVIS, M.D., MISS.
W.H. WATSON, M.D., BAMSON, MISS.
J.H. WINDHAM, M.D., PERU, MISS.
Mississippi State Board of Health
W.S. LEATHERS, M.D., EXECUTIVE OFFICER
JACKSON, MISS.
Sept. 17, 1923.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
c/o Badin Hospital,
Badin, N. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I have your letter of September 14th
and I am certainly sorry to know that you are not well.
I said nothing about you except what was true and I
think that nothing else could have been said. You
have rendered a great service in your time and it and
your name will be forever connected with the pioneer
times of public health work in this country.

I hope that I may have the pleasure
of seeing you again on your feet happy and well.

With kindest personal regards, I
am
div1.closer: Cordially your friend, W. S. Leathers wsl-w
